intro: Phyllorkis ciliata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed rock heath, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions. It is often found in coastal and inland regions, thriving in well-drained environments. Phyllorkis ciliata plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for native wildlife.
